title: Sri Lanka state firms to buy 230,000MT fertilizer for next cropping season: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of minister has given approval for state-run firms to import up to 231,000 metric tonnes of rice for the 2022/2023 main cultivation season, cabinet spokesman, Minister Bandula Gunewardene said.
Colombo Commercial Fertilizer and Lanka Fertilizer will import the fertilizer, he said.
The two firms were given approval to import up to 150,000 metric tonnes of urea, 45,000 metric tonnes muriate of potash and 36,000 metric tonnes triple super phosphate, he said.
The cabinet had also approved payment to 65,000 metric tonnes of fertilizer from India for the current season, he said.
Sri Lanka cabinet had approved the borrowing 55 million US dollars from the Exim Bank of India to pay for fertilizer.
